description: From Middle English womanhoode, wommanhod, whomanhode, variants of wommanhede; synchronically analyzable as woman +â€Ž -hood.

entries.meaning: The state or condition of being a woman.
All of the women of a given place, area, or subgroup regarded collectively.
examples: Synonym: womankind (universally: only synonymous when the meaning of womanhood is universal or worldwide)

entries.meaning: The idealized nature of a woman: all of the characteristics traditionally and ideally ascribed to womanliness regarded collectively.

The self-concept of a woman with respect to her possession of the various qualities traditionally and ideally ascribed to womanliness; a woman's sense or view of herself as being more or less womanly.
(euphemistic) The female genitalia, especially the vulva.
